1.title: Episode #2.1
1.plot: The BBC's daily political programme returns. The delayed vote on the Brexit deal, the letter urging the Prime Minister to rule out a no-deal Brexit, Brexit preparations, the 10-year-plan for the NHS and Brexit (2019) are discussed.

2.title: Episode #2.2
2.plot: Jo Coburn and her guests discuss abuse in politics, can direct action be justified? The rise of populism, could article 50 be extended? Is Britain ready for a no-deal Brexit? Prison reform and a 2nd Scottish independence referendum.

3.title: Episode #2.3
3.plot: Andrew Neil presents live coverage of the first Prime Minister's Questions of 2019. Plus, the latest defeat for the government and President Trump's televised speech about the government shutdown.

4.title: Episode #2.4
4.plot: Ahead of next week's meaningful vote in the House of Commons on the Government's Brexit deal Jo Coburn discusses the possible outcomes with her guests. Plus, is the Speaker of the House biased?

5.title: Episode #2.5
5.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

6.title: Episode #2.6
6.plot: Jo Coburn asks - how much support is there for the Government's Brexit deal? Is a no deal Brexit likely? Could parliament take control of Brexit? Will we run out of loo roll if there is no deal?

7.title: Special - 14/01/2019
7.plot: Jo Coburn presents the first of four special editions in the week of the House of Commons vote on the Government's Brexit deal. Can the Prime Minister get her deal through the House? What happens if she loses the vote?

8.title: Episode #2.8
8.plot: Jo Coburn and her guests look at what is at stake in tonight's Brexit vote, is the Government heading for defeat? Will a defeat lead to Labour calling for a confidence vote? Does the Prime Minister have a plan B?

9.title: Special - 15/01/2019
9.plot: Live coverage of the historic vote in the House of Commons on the Government's Brexit deal, any amendments and statements to the House. Plus, analysis, interviews and discussion.

10.title: Episode #2.10
10.plot: Andrew Neil and his guests digest the historic defeat for the Government in last night's vote on the Brexit deal, discuss the forthcoming confidence vote in the Government and what happens next.

11.title: Special - 16/01/2019
11.plot: Jo Coburn presents live coverage of the vote of no confidence in the government. Plus, Andrew Neil interviews Conservative Brexiteer Jacob Rees-Mogg.

12.title: Episode #2.12
12.plot: Jo Coburn asks - Can the parties agree over Brexit? Should no-deal be ruled out? Is the cabinet divided? Can Parliament take control of Brexit? Has the EU miscalculated over Brexit?

13.title: Special - 17/01/2019
13.plot: As the Prime Minister and government ministers hold cross party talks on Brexit Andrew Neil asks if the parties can come to agreement. Plus, Andrew interviews Tony Blair.

14.title: Episode #2.14
14.plot: Jo Coburn asks her guests - should calories be printed on menus? Could the date of Brexit be delayed and is it time for a general election? Plus, discrimination in the jobs market.

15.title: Episode #2.15
15.plot: Jo Coburn and her guests discuss - are MP's seizing control of the Brexit process? Can a way be found to break the Brexit deadlock? Plus, mental health in the workplace and the registration of EU nationals.

16.title: Episode #2.16
16.plot: Jo Coburn asks - What is the difference between Theresa May's Brexit Plan A and Plan B? Or Jeremy Corbyn's? Will Brussels budge on the backstop? Plus, a report on debt and mental health.

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: Jo is joined by Amber Rudd and Emily Thornberry for the 1st edition of the show. They discuss the toxic nature of political debate, Boris Johnson's latest comments on Brexit, drugs testing and how realistic is Bodyguard (2018)?

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Jo is joined by Jess Phillips, Elizabeth Truss and Tim Martin. They discuss the crisis in local government funding, accusations of antisemitism in the Labour Party and taxation of tech companies.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Jo Coburn is joined by a panel of guests to discuss the latest political developments. Then it is over to the House of Commons for live coverage of Prime Minister's Questions followed by a statement to the house by the PM.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Anti-Israel bus stop posters, the anonymous op-ed about the Trump White House, the Russian agents accused of the Salisbury attack, Brexit contingency plans and food gleaning are discussed.

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Jo and her guests discuss Vince Cable's proposals for electing a new party leader, cooking and food poverty and whether teachers should be allowed to campaign politically.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot: Brexit, splits within the Conservative Party, Boris Johnson, splits within the Labour Party, a Centrist revival, Swedish elections and a promotional video by Donald Tusk are all discussed by Jo and the panel of guests.

7.title: Episode #1.7
7.plot: Jo and her guests discuss the impact of police funding cuts, What is a hard brexiteer? Is a November Brexit deal possible? Are voters tired of Brexit? Should there be a 2nd referendum? The 'toxic nature' of masculinity is also discussed.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: Is there a plot to oust Theresa May? Would Jesus have been a trade unionist? Brexit, the Irish Border, Universal Credit and child poverty are discussed. Plus live coverage from Prime Minister's Questions.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Brexit, the cost of no-deal, the Salisbury attack suspects television interview and Labour's post-Brexit immigration policy are discussed as are funeral poverty and threatening behaviour in politics.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: Is the Archbishop of Canterbury a hypocrite? How will Brexit affect house prices? Should Theresa May stand down after Brexit? Is Veganism a fad? Should anti-abortion protests outside abortion clinics be banned?

12.title: Episode #1.12
12.plot: The Liberal Democrat party conference and leader Vince Cable's speech are discussed. Fake road signs to deter drug dealers, Britian's immigration policy post-Brexit and a second vote on Brexit are also discussed.

13.title: Episode #1.13
13.plot: Jo Coburn asks the new co-leader of the Green Party Siân Berry what her priorities are. Funding for new housing, the EU leaders summit in Salzburg and the falling rates of take-up for the MMR vaccine are also discussed.

14.title: Episode #1.14
14.plot: Andrew Neil is joined by Jacob Rees-Mogg, Alastair Campbell, Rachel Sylvester and Claire Fox to discuss the EU leader's summit. Also, is there a "deep state" undermining Jeremy Corbyn?

15.title: Episode #1.15
15.plot: Today's edition is taken over by the Brexitcast podcast. Adam Fleming, Chris Mason, Katya Adler and Laura Kuenssberg report live from various locations across Europe on the fallout from the EU leader's summit.

16.title: Episode #1.16
16.plot: Jo Coburn speaks to Unite head Len McCluskey and presents live coverage of shadow chancellor John McDonnell's speech from the Labour Party conference in Liverpool.

17.title: Episode #1.17
17.plot: Jo Coburn presents live coverage of the Labour Party conference in Liverpool. Including an interview with deputy leader Tom Watson and shadow Brexit secretary Keir Starmer's speech to conference.

18.title: Episode #1.18
18.plot: Jo Coburn presents live coverage of Jeremy Corbyn's leader's speech from the Labour Party conference in Liverpool.

19.title: Episode #1.19
19.plot: Andrew Neil asks his panel of guests if Labour are ready to govern? Can the Prime Minister stick with her chequers plan? They also discuss the emerging details about one of the Salisbury attackers.

20.title: Episode #1.20
20.plot: Jo Coburn discusses the Senate hearings in Washington, Boris Johnson's criticisms of Theresa May, engaging young voters and gay and transgender rights with her guests.

21.title: Episode #1.21
21.plot: Jo Coburn presents live coverage from the second day of the Conservative Party conference in Birmingham. Including full coverage of Chancellor Philip Hammond's speech.

22.title: Episode #1.22
22.plot: Jo Coburn presents live coverage from the Conservative Party conference in Birmingham ahead of Boris Johnson's eagerly anticipated speech to delegates.

23.title: Episode #1.23
23.plot: Jo Coburn presents live coverage of the Conservative Party conference in Birmingham, including Prime Minister Theresa May's closing speech.

24.title: Episode #1.24
24.plot: Reaction to Theresa May's dancing (and speech) at the Conservative Party conference, is it really the end of austerity? Will a new proposal solve the Irish border issue? Plus a report on families separated by visa rules.

25.title: Episode #1.25
25.plot: Is the UK one of the least racist societies in Europe? The meeting between Northern Irish parties and Michel Barnier, student politics and the Brett Kavanaugh controversy are discussed.

26.title: Episode #1.26
26.plot: Topics discussed include - would you eat less meat to save the planet? Could Brexit lead to an independent Scotland? Plus universal credit, the end of austerity and academic study of the British Empire.

27.title: Episode #1.27
27.plot: Can a Brexit deal get through the Commons? What happens if it doesn't? The impact of state pension age increases and what do Conservative and Labour supporters think of each other?

28.title: Episode #1.28
28.plot: Andrew Neil is joined by former Conservative chief whip Mark Harper, shadow treasury minister Anneliese Dodds and BBC political editor Laura Kuenssberg for PMQ's.

29.title: Episode #1.29
29.plot: Should firms reveal their ethnicity pay gap? Are the DUP bluffing in their threats to oppose the government? How can rents be made affordable? Plus universal credit and the teaching of history are discussed.

30.title: Episode #1.30
30.plot: Jo Coburn is joined by guests including Labour MP Siobhain McDonagh, Ukip leader Gerard Batten and journalist Toby Young to discuss the day's politics.

31.title: Episode #1.31
31.plot: Jo Coburn discusses the days politics including the culture in the House of Commons and the role of the speaker with her guests.

32.title: Episode #1.32
32.plot: Jo discusses with her guests - the report into bullying in parliament, the position of the speaker, the EU leaders meeting, universal credit and a robot giving evidence to the Education Select Committee.

33.title: Episode #1.33
33.plot: Jo Coburn discusses with her guests - the future of the speaker, the Prime Minister's meeting with EU leaders, the Irish border issue and the mistakes made in the 2017 General Election. Plus coverage of PMQs.

34.title: Episode #1.34
34.plot: Jo Coburn discusses with her guests - Could the Brexit transition period be extended? Will MPs get a meaningful vote on a deal? Diabetes treatment and gender self-identification are also discussed.

35.title: Episode #1.35
35.plot: Tory MP Johnny Mercer's criticism of his own party, Brexit negotiations, a second referendum on Brexit, gender self-identification and pressure on local government finances are discussed.

36.title: Episode #1.36
36.plot: Jo Coburn discusses with her guests - the future of John Bercow, Brexit, social media regulation and social media in politics and whether autism awareness training should be compulsory in the health-care sector.

37.title: Episode #1.37
37.plot: Topics discussed include - how should the UK respond to the Khashoggi killing? Should post Brexit transition be extended? Is the world more dangerous today? Has sexual harrassment become normalised?

38.title: Episode #1.38
38.plot: Andrew Neil asks his guests - How long should the Brexit transition last? What would a no deal Brexit look like? What should be the response to Saudi Arabia? Plus live coverage of Prime Minister's Questions.

39.title: Episode #1.39
39.plot: Are non disclosure agreements being abused? Has austerity ended? Local government funding, Brexit, Labours's spending plans, populism and the bombing campaign in the U.S. are also discussed.

40.title: Episode #1.40
40.plot: Emma Barnett sits in for Jo Coburn. Was Peter Hain right to use parliamentary privilege to name Philip Green? Does Universal Credit work? The trophy hunting scandal, apprenticeships, Brexit and the Reformation.

41.title: Budget 2018
41.plot: Andrew Neil presents the BBC's coverage of Budget Day 2018. Including live coverage of the Chancellor of the Exchequer Philip Hammond's delivery of his budget to the House of Commons and the opposition responses.

42.title: Episode #1.42
42.plot: Jo Coburn asks her guests is austerity over? Taxing tech firms, why are so many children excluded? Plus analysis of the budget.

43.title: Episode #1.43
43.plot: Analysis of the budget continues with Andrew Neil asking his guests who benefits from the budget? Who will replace Angela Merkel? Plus coverage of PMQs.

44.title: Episode #1.44
44.plot: Jo Coburn discusses with her guests the delay in imposing a limit of gaming machines and the funding of the leave campaign. Plus, should attacks on rough sleepers be classed as a hate crime?

45.title: Episode #1.45
45.plot: Jo asks her guests - Can former Prime Minister's make a comeback? Are we afraid of free speech? Are we too easily offended? Plus, the resignation of sports minister Tracey Crouch is discussed.

46.title: Episode #1.46
46.plot: Health and personal responsibility, who is the party of the NHS? the American mid-term elections, how close are we to a Brexit deal? Technology and politics are discussed.

47.title: Episode #1.47
47.plot: The Information Commissioner's select committee appearance discussing disinformation and fake news, the American mid-term elections, knife crime and the life of war correspondent Marie Colvin are discussed.

48.title: Episode #1.48
48.plot: The resignation of Jo Johnson, Labour's Brexit position and the rise of nationalism are discussed by Jo and her guests. Elizabeth Glinka interviews Independent MP Jared O'Mara.

49.title: Episode #1.49
49.plot: Jo Coburn asks - Is a Brexit deal imminent? Could there be a second referendum? The use of data and technology in political campaigning and the banned Iceland advert are also discussed.

50.title: Episode #1.50
50.plot: Andrew Neil asks his guests if the Prime Minister can get her draft Brexit deal approved by cabinet. Plus, live coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons.

51.title: Episode #1.51
51.plot: Jo Coburn presents a special extended edition of the programme on a dramatic day for the government following a series of resignations over the Prime Minister's proposed Brexit deal.

52.title: Episode #1.52
52.plot: Jo Coburn discusses with her guests - Theresa May's leadership, the EU withdrawal deal, market reaction to the deal, Tory backbench anger at the deal and a second referendum.

53.title: Episode #1.53
53.plot: Jo Coburn discusses with her guests - the Brexit plan, the Prime Minister's speech to business leaders, turmoil in the Conservative Party and the funding of the Leave.EU campaign.

54.title: Episode #1.54
54.plot: Jo Coburn discusses - Is the Prime Minister safe from her own backbenchers? the DUP's warning to the PM, do property guardians need more rights and changes to Universal Credit.

55.title: Episode #1.55
55.plot: Andrew Neil asks - Can Parliament stop a no-deal Brexit? Can Nicola Sturgeon form an alliance of opposition to Brexit? Are students setting themselves up to fail? Plus, live coverage of PMQs.

56.title: Episode #1.56
56.plot: Jo Coburn and her guests discuss - the latest Brexit developments, how to help young people get on the housing ladder and look at the new BBC documentary about the Foreign Office.

57.title: Episode #1.57
57.plot: Jo Coburn discusses - Spanish threats to 'veto' Brexit over Gibraltar, the criticism of the Prime Minister's Brexit deal from her own party and a Democratic challenger to Donald Trump.

58.title: Episode #1.58
58.plot: Jo discusses with her guests - the Prime Minister's public campaign for her deal, Brexit boredom, the pros and cons of the gig economy and rising tensions between Russia and Ukraine.

59.title: Episode #1.59
59.plot: Should there be a television debate on Brexit? Is Donald Trump criticism of the Brexit deal correct? Is Universal Credit working? What can the UK do about the Russia Ukraine standoff?

60.title: Episode #1.60
60.plot: Andrew Neil presents live coverage of Prime Minister's Questions. He and his guests also discuss - will the government lose the Brexit vote? Escalating tensions between Russia and Ukraine and the economic impact of Brexit.

61.title: Episode #1.61
61.plot: Jo discusses with her guests - a Brexit deal TV debate, no-deal Brexit warnings from the Bank of England, police tactics to deal with moped gangs and are memes going to be banned by the EU?

62.title: Episode #1.62
62.plot: Jo and her guests discuss - the MP who announced in the Commons that he is HIV Positive, the G20 Summit, a Brexit plan B, foetal alcohol spectrum disorders and Gareth Southgate comments on Brexit.

63.title: Episode #1.63
63.plot: The Home Secretary's reaction to the attack on a Syrian refugee schoolboy, the demand to release the Attorney General's full legal advice on the Brexit deal, climate change and the violent protests in France are discussed.

64.title: Episode #1.64
64.plot: Should Transport Secretary Chris Grayling resign over the chaos on the railways? Can the UK unilaterally withdraw from article 50? Suzanne Evans's decision to quit UKIP and the rise of nationalist parties across Europe are discussed.

65.title: Episode #1.65
65.plot: Andrew Neil presents live coverage of Prime Minister's Questions. Plus, reaction to the government's calamitous loss in 3 Commons votes, the continuing protests in France and the publication of the Brexit legal advice.

66.title: Episode #1.66
66.plot: Can the PM get her Brexit deal through parliament? Should we stay in the single market? Can Theresa May keep her party together? Is no deal still an option? Should second homes be banned?

67.title: Episode #1.67
67.plot: Jo Coburn asks - What happens if the PM loses her Brexit deal vote? Or could she pull the vote? How divided is the country? Plus, an interview with a comedian who is a newcomer to politics Luisa Omielan.

68.title: Episode #1.68
68.plot: Jo Coburn and her panel of guests react to the breaking news that the Prime Minister may be about to delay Parliament's vote on her Brexit deal. What next for her and her deal?

69.title: Episode #1.69
69.plot: Jo asks - Was the Prime Minister right to delay the vote on her deal? Can she change her deal? How much support does the PM have? Could there be a vote of confidence in the PM? Is the speaker impartial?

70.title: Episode #1.70
70.plot: Andrew Neil presents live coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons on the day in which Theresa May faces a vote of no confidence from her own party.

71.title: Episode #1.71
71.plot: Jo and her guests discuss - Theresa May surviving the confidence vote and travelling to Brussels. Can she get more from the EU? Is no deal still on the table, how likely is a another referendum?

72.title: Episode #1.72
72.plot: What now for the Brexit negotiations after Brussels refusal to negotiate further on the withdrawal agreement? Do our mental health services work? Are food banks a photo op too far?

73.title: Episode #1.73
73.plot: Should MP's have a free vote on Brexit? Is the UK prepared to leave without a deal?and the impact of Brexit on the UK's computer game industry are discussed.

74.title: Episode #1.74
74.plot: Jo and her guests discuss - government plans for recycling, the problem of rough sleeping, Labour's call for a vote of no confidence in the Prime Minister and the use of facial recognition technology.

75.title: Episode #1.75
75.plot: Andrew Neil discusses the latest political developments with his guests before live coverage of PMQs. Does Jeremy Corbyn call Theresa May a stupid woman in the house?

76.title: Episode #1.76
76.plot: Jo Coburn discusses the big issues of the day and reflects on the political events of the year. What can be done about rough sleeping? Are reality TV stars better role models than politicians?

imdb.plot outline: Jo Coburn presents the BBC's new daily politics programme offering viewers a fast-moving, conversational show, featuring a blend of political interviews, discussion and video content designed to be shared digitally. Four days a week Jo will be joined by a panel of guests to discuss the big issues of the day, delving into the world of politics from Westminster and beyond. Andrew Neil presents a special extended edition of the programme on Wednesdays that will include live coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the chamber of the House of Commons followed by analysis and reaction to the pivotal event in the parliamentary week.
imdb.title: Politics Live
plot: 'Jo Coburn' (qv) and a panel of guests discuss the big issues of the day in politics from Westminster and beyond. With 'Andrew Neil' (qv) presenting an extended edition on Wednesdays featuring live PMQs.::Mark_a_Wood <markawood@hotmail.co.uk>

'Jo Coburn' (qv) presents the BBC's new daily politics programme offering viewers a fast-moving, conversational show, featuring a blend of political interviews, discussion and video content designed to be shared digitally. Four days a week Jo will be joined by a panel of guests to discuss the big issues of the day, delving into the world of politics from Westminster and beyond. 'Andrew Neil' (qv) presents a special extended edition of the programme on Wednesdays that will include live coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the chamber of the House of Commons followed by analysis and reaction to the pivotal event in the parliamentary week.::Mark_a_Wood <markawood@hotmail.co.uk>
